description: From Middle English bismerwen, from Old English besmirwan, besmierwan (“to besmear”), equivalent to be- +‎ smear. Cognate with Dutch besmeren (“to besmear”), German beschmieren (“to besmear”).

verbs.description: besmear (third-person singular simple present besmears, present participle besmearing, simple past and past participle besmeared)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To smear over; smear all over; sully.
